result.execSummary:
The defendant Quincy Donte Sandlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, cash bail to apply. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continued programming.
Successfully complete a parenting class.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
No possession of controlled substance without a valid prescription.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Quincy Donte Sandlin in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Quincy Donte Sandlin in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   

Defendant sentenced to serve 7 months in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served. Huber release for work only.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 08/21/2015.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continued programming.
-Successfully complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
-No prosession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, cash bail to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.

Probation can be terminated after 12 months if all of the conditions of probation are successfully completed.

Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
in support of the defendant receieved and filed.
Court modified the no contact order to allow for 3rd party contact for the purpose of child visitation.

Defendant Quincy Donte Sandlin in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Quincy Donte Sandlin in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 4/15/15 in Branch 40.  State still needs to obtain the 911 call and get a copy to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Quincy Donte Sandlin in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Quincy Donte Sandlin in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Flanagan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dallet, Branch 4.  Case transferred FORTHWITH to Branch 40 for Scheduling Conference.   mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kameela R. or the residence or place of employment

Defendant Quincy Donte Sandlin in court.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Scheduling Conference in Branch 04.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/26/15 @ 1:30 pm
